did.unittitle: Warren Chappell Bloody Mary Kit, n.d.
did.abstract: The collections consists of Warren Chappell's "Bloody Mary Kit" containing drawings on a vodka bottle, a glass jar, and a cardboard cover, all in a customized cardboard box.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Warren Chappell, Bloody Mary Kit, n.d., #10204-an, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items were given to the Library by William B. O'Neal, Charlottesville, Virginia, on June 24, 1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This addition to the Warren Chappell Collection contains three items, undated, comprising a "Bloody Mary Kit" designed by illustrator Warren Chappell (1904-1991), using pen and ink drawings, consisting of an insert "Bloody Mary Kit/No Flavor Added" depicting an executioner's axe and mask; a jar labeled "Pete's Bloody" featuring an axe and a chopping block; a Gordon's vodka bottle with a label pasted over the original label, reading "Pete's Vodka/80 Proof/Pete's Mary" with a picture of a headsman striking off the woman's head. These items are in a customized cardboard box measuring 6 1/2 x 12 inches.
